intro: Eufragia flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered eufragia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
